title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire - BBC News
summary: pizza delivery man 's killers jailed for 13 and nine years each .
half northstowe 's 3,500 phase 2 houses could be 'affordable ' .
children in need 's rickshaw challenge departs cambridgeshire on final day .

documents.title: weather : isolated showers and widespread frost
text: a largely dry night with isolated showers and a fairly widespread frost , but a warning that some icy patches could develop as temperatures in some spots fall to freezing .
saturday will be another cold day with sunny spells and perhaps an odd shower .
it 'll be less windy than today with the temperature peaking at 6c ( 43f ) .
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: widow 's 'heartbreak ' at pizza delivery man 's death
text: fawzia qasemi read a victim impact sentence to the court in which she said : `` the fact our baby wo n't be able to see him to hold his hand breaks my heart . ''
mr qasemi was a refugee who fled the war in afghanistan and the couple had two older sons aged seven and 11 .
mrs qasemi described him as the `` backbone '' of the family and added : `` i will never overcome the pain and hurt of losing him in such a tragic way . ''
she said her husband 's attackers were `` pure evil '' .
mrs qasemi watched lintott and lawson being sentenced over a video link from another room in cambridge crown court , because she was accompanied by her eight-week-old baby .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: pizza driver 's killers 'robbed ' family of 'hard-working and much-loved man '
text: now back to the sentencing of two men from cambridgeshire and norfolk for killing a pizza delivery driver in peterborough .

when judge david farrell , sitting at cambridge crown court , jailed mark lintott and joel lawson , he said : `` neither of you showed an ounce of concern for the welfare of the man you had been party to knocking to the ground .
`` you both ate the pizzas , laughed and joked about what had just gone on . ''
he then told the killers the `` deliberately planned robbery '' had robbed a family `` of a hard-working and much-loved man '' .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: families evicted for homeless centre
text: families evicted for homeless centre

documents.title: men jailed for pizza-grab killing
text: men jailed for pizza-grab killing

documents.title: children in need : earith primary school tries the 'mannequin challenge '
text: pudsey 's also been challenging the children of earith primary school to do the latest social media phenomenon - the `` mannequin challenge '' .
it turns out small children struggle to stay still
author: Sue Marchant
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: children in need : pudsey 's school tour
text: and pudsey 's also been out all week , dropping in on schools
he 's asked us to say thank you very much indeed for inviting him for a visit !
author: Sue Marchant
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: children in need : pudsey spotted in cambridge
text: as you might expect on children in need day , it 's been a busy one for pudsey .
he nipped down to lion yard in cambridge earlier , where he met these fundraisers
author: Sue Marchant
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : sunny and cold
text: what a difference a day makes .
yesterday we were lashed with rain - today it 's glorious sunshine on autumn leaves in barrington , from bbc weather watcher `` maggiemay '' .
but there 's still the risk of the odd shower in a chilly wind and highs of 6c ( 42f ) .
for a more up-to-date weather forecast where you live , go to bbc weather .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: ali qasemi : the 'devoted husband ' killed for the price of three pizzas
text: ali qasemi 's wife fawzia was pregnant with their third child when he was killed .
the 45-year-old was delivering three pizzas costing just over £ 50 when he was attacked .
speaking after last month 's trial , det insp lucy thomson , from cambridgeshire police , described it as a `` sickening , senseless crime '' that had `` devastated '' the qasemi family .
`` they have lost a loving , devoted husband and father , devastating their close-knit family , all for the price of three pizzas , '' she said .
following mr qasemi 's death , his employer pizza hut uk said it had reviewed its training methods for drivers .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: breakingpair jailed for killing driver for pizzas
text: two men who killed a takeaway delivery driver in a `` snatch and grab '' robbery for three pizzas have been jailed .
pizza hut worker ali qasemi , 45 , died in may , two days after he was punched and left dying on the pavement in peterborough .
mark lintott ( left ) , 29 , of peterborough , who was found guilty of robbery and manslaughter at a trial last month , was jailed for 13 years at cambridge crown court .
joel lawson ( right ) , 25 , of norwich , who earlier admitted both charges , was jailed for nine years .
during lintott 's trial in peterborough , the court heard he and lawson had been drinking with friends when they came up with their plan to take the food from the driver without paying .
author: Emma Baugh
BBC Look East

documents.title: northstowe : a 10,000-home new town
text: up to 25,000 people are eventually expected to live in northstowe and it 's hoped the first residents will move in next year .
developer gallagher estates has promised a £ 73m investment in community facilities including a town centre , two primary schools and a secondary school .
phase 2 is expected to start in 2019 , but one of its planning conditions is that no resident can move into this part of the development until the a14 is upgraded - work is now under way on that .
of course , one of the initial conditions of the northstowe development was there should also be a public transport alternative for cambridge commuters .
the guided busway ( see above ) has been ready for the new town 's residents since 2011 .
northstowe is about five miles ( 8km ) north-east of cambridge and will have nearly 10,000 homes on completion .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: northstowe : fewer 'affordable ' rented homes in new proposal
text: while the homes and community agency proposal looks like good news for people hoping to get on the housing ladder , it 's not such good news for the 1,800 people looking to get off south cambridgeshire 's housing waiting list .
under the new phase 2 plan , 10 % of the units will be available to `` local people on housing waiting lists '' - which is the equivalent of 350 homes .
but the previous phase 2 plan was for 420 homes to be available at an `` affordable '' rent .

south cambridgeshire councillor tim wotherspoon said : `` everyone knows there is a pressing demand for more housing in the area to help people on all incomes , whether they are looking to rent or buy . ''
the council is keen to hear what its residents think about the proposal .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: king 's lynn town sign winger hawkins
text: king 's lynn town have completed the signing of st neots winger ryan hawkins .
the 21-year-old , who used to play for dereham town , had recently been on trial with league two side newport county .
he 's signed a deal with the linnets which lasts until the end of the 2018/19 season .
hawkins could make his debut for lynn in tomorrow 's clash with banbury united at the walks .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: northstowe : a boost for cambridgeshire people desperate for a home ?
text: it 's just been announced that half the 3,500 properties being built at northstowe during its second phase could be sold or rented at lower prices .
the original proposal for phase 2 included 20 % `` affordable housing '' , made up of 420 units ( 60 % ) for `` affordable rent '' and 280 ( 40 % ) for shared ownership .
what 's now being offered is 40 % starter homes and 10 % `` affordable rent '' homes , which are available to local residents on the housing waiting list .
the long-awaited new town is one of five pilot sites hosting a government starter homes initiative .

this means the government will give first-time buyers aged between 23 and 40 a 20 % discount on the market price of a home , but the maximum cost of the property after discount can not exceed £ 250,000 .
the council wants residents to have their say on the proposals .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge : goodbye cambridgeshire , hello hertfordshire
text: so it 's now time for the rickshaw challenge to say goodbye to cambridgeshire as the team pedals into hertfordshire , heading towards puckeridge on the final leg of their journey .
the sun is out today , which is a bonus , after they were beaten by relentless rain on the a10 just south of ely yesterday .
matt baker said : `` we had unbelievable , unprecedented storm weather and the hail hurt your face .
`` olivia was in the saddle and the green coat she was wearing under two other layers is still sodden - but you know what , she pushed through .
`` there 's a chilling wind today , but we 've a spring in our step because it 's our final day . ''
the team of young people riding with matt are andy , ebony , olivia , phoebe , ross and salar - and so far they have raised £ 1.4m .

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge : and they 're off
text: they 're back in the saddle .
matt baker and his team of young riders have already set off from duxford to finish their rickshaw challenge by the end of the day in london .
we 've been checking the online tracker and they 're currently around great chishill on their way to hertfordshire .
in total they 'll have travelled 470 miles from scotland to the capital .
so far they 've raised £ 1.4m .
author: Children in Need

documents.title: sentencing due in pizza driver death case
text: two men are due to be sentenced today for the manslaughter and robbery of pizza hut worker ali qasemi , 45 , who died in may , two days after he was punched and left dying on the pavement in peterborough .
mark lintott , 29 , of peterborough , and joel lawson , 25 , of norwich , will find out their jail terms at cambridge crown court later .

documents.title: third council signs up to devolution
text: peterborough city council has voted to be part of a cambridgeshire combined authority , led by an elected mayor .
at a meeting last night 33 of the councillors voted for the devolution deal and 18 were against it .
peterborough is the third of our authorities to back the plan , which will mean decisions on matters like transport and housing are made locally rather than at westminster .
the other authorities that have announced they are in are east cambridgeshire and huntingdonshire district councils .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

last night they arrived in duxford and today they 'll travel out of cambridgeshire on the a505 , then onto the b1368 to great chishall and then onto london .
we wish them all a very safe and successful journey .

documents.title: weather : cold with the risk of frost
text: brrr !
most places will feel much colder and there 's the risk of frost and icy patches as clear spells develop overnight .
southern counties may also get the odd shower .
temperatures dropping to 0c ( 32f ) .
tomorrow will start frosty in places but it will be a mainly dry and bright day .
cold though with temperatures of 7c ( 45f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: world prematurity day marked by special exhibition at rosie
text: the rosie neonatal intensive care unit ( nicu ) in cambridge is holding a photography exhibition of its 'graduate ' babies born prematurely .
the event is to mark world prematurity day .
families have been invited to a tea party to see their on display and meet some of the key people that cared for them .
one of those graduates will be paralympic cyclist , louis rolfe , who will be attending with his sister who was also born early .
on average , about 77 babies are born prematurely in the east every week .
most receive care at one of three specialist neo-natal centres in cambridge , luton and norwich .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: u 's hoping for second round win and cash boost
text: cambridge united says they 'd love the financial boost of an fa cup second round tie .
the u 's are facing dover tonight for a place in round two .
they 've already made about £ 50,000 from the competition and manager , shaun derry , says the money will come in very useful :
`` the financial aspects of the deal are very , very rewarding , '' he said .
`` we want the money as well as the round two . ''
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: brad inman could return to peterborough squad for cobblers clash
text: midfielder brad inman is in contention to be included in the peterborough united squad for the local derby at northampton on saturday .
the summer signing from crewe , who broke his leg in pre-season , featured for the reserves against bournemouth in midweek .
boss grant mccann told bbc radio cambridgeshire : `` it was great to see brad back , he 's still a bit tentative going into tackles but he felt good in the game .
he 's in contention for the squad for this weekend . ''
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: million of pounds of investment secured to fight antibiotic resistance
text: a cambridgeshire company has secured millions of pounds of investment to develop a new treatment in the fight against antibiotic resistance .
phico therapeutics , which is based at the babraham research campus , has raised £ 3.5m , to start clinical trials of the treatment pt3 , to target antibiotic resistant infections in hospitals .
experts say treatment-resistant infections pose one of the biggest known threats to humanity today .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cambridgeshire rural crime team in action
text: i 've been on the beat with officers from the cambridgeshire police 's rural crime team for five days .
here 's just a small snapshot of my time with the officers .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

text: how do we honour galloping greats ?

here they are as they rode through stretham .
@ twitterid rickshaw challenge passing @ twitterid stretham , cambs , in terrible weather , well done guys # rickshawchallenge
author: Children in Need

documents.title: over 100 knives handed in to police
text: an amnesty in cambridgeshire has resulted in 147 knives being handed in .
in peterborough , mobile bins were set up as part of a week-long initiative from 16 to 23 october .
cambridgeshire police says a number of test purchases also took place and six retail outlets failed to comply with legislation .
the force says it 's `` pleased with the response '' and is now liaising with the management of those stores to make sure it does n't happen again .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulance service reports 19 % increase in assaults
text: figures from the east of england ambulance service show there 's been a 19 % increase in reported violence against staff , in the year 2015-16 .
the service says there were 232 physical assaults , compared to 195 in 2014-15 , with criminal sanctions brought against 66 people .
chief executive robert morton said : `` it is appalling that some people are violent towards our staff when they are trying to help and provide the best possible care to patients .
`` one assault against a colleague is one too many . ''

documents.title: armed robberies 'linked ' in cambridge
text: five armed robberies at bookmakers and shops in cambridge are being linked by cambridgeshire police .
two masked men wearing dark clothing have been going into the premises armed with knives , threatening staff before leaving with money from tills and gaming machines , the force said .
the incidents took place since october in chesterton road , high street , east chesterton , newmarket road , victoria road and rectory terrace in cherry hinton .
police say the incidents have left `` multiple victims , severely affected '' .
author: Julia Greenaway
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: top marks for teaching mentor
text: this is jackie johnson , who has just won the first pupil-nominated power for good award , launched by the anti-bullying alliance to mark anti-bullying week .
she works as a learning mentor at orton wistow primary school in peterborough .
i met her back at work this morning after she was presented with the award at the houses of parliament last night .
she said it was an `` amazing '' night , although she 's a little tired .
jackie says she 's very humbled by the award and says it 's a `` lovely feeling '' , as her job is to make sure children have someone to talk to about all issues , including bullying .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge : hello from ely
text: crowds have been out in force to welcome the cin rickshaw challenge team as it travels through cambridgeshire .
these pupils from king 's ely were very pleased to show their support .
their next stop is stretham .

our kej pupils enjoyed welcoming the @ twitterid # rickshawchallenge to # ely this afternoon !

author: Children in Need

documents.title: rural crime fight goes on '24/7 '
text: as a reporter i 'm used to following different stories , but after being with cambridgeshire police 's rural crime team i 'm shattered !
i 've followed them day and night for just the past five days , and am ready for a rest .
but for them , the fight goes on 24/7 .
on day one , within three hours we were involved in a high-speed pursuit , on road and off .
on this occasion the hare coursers got away , but on three occasions on the following days i saw police apprehend and arrest other suspects .
what really struck me was the continued energy these officers showed .
often covering 300 miles each a day , mostly under blue lights and sirens , they displayed immense driving skills and courage .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

text: met office issue wind warning

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge : the route through cambridgeshire
text: so the cin rickshaw challenge team have come through littleport and are currently on the a10..
they are set to go through chettisham on the way to ely , then stretham .
from there they 'll go to wilburton , down the b1049 , then onto cottenham , histon and impington .
next the route will go through orchard park , down arbury road , into cambridge .
they will travel down elizabeth way , east road , onto conville place , then lensfield road and next trumpington road .
they 'll pedal through trumpington on the a1309 , then next onto the a1301 to great shelford in the direction of pampisford .
after that it 's the a606 towards duxford - finishing at the imperial war museum .
phew , i think we all need a lie down now !
author: Children in Need

documents.title: devolution for cambridgeshire moves a step closer
text: east cambridgeshire and huntingdonshire district councils become the first districts in cambridgeshire to vote for devolution last night .

if the other councils accept the plans over the next week , it could mean decisions on things like housing and transport could be made by a combined authority covering the whole of cambridgeshire , led by an elected mayor , instead of by people in london .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge : meet the team
text: six young people are riding through cambridgeshire as part of the cin rickshaw challenge .
they are salar , ebony , andy , phoebe , ross , andy and olivia - and are joined by the one show presenter matt baker .
we wish them all the best as they travel through cambridgeshire on the penultimate day of their journey .
they 're due to finish day seven in duxford later .
author: Children in Need

documents.title: cin ricksaw challenge arrives in cambridgeshire
text: we 've just checked the coordinates and it looks like the cin rickshaw challenge team are now in cambridgeshire .
the pudsey viewranger shows they are right by the a10 , by ten mile bank .
to support the challenge , you can donate either £ 5 or £ 10 by text .
to donate £ 5 text team to 70405 , or to donate £ 10 text team to 70410 .
texts will cost your donation plus your standard network message charge , and all of your donation will go to bbc children in need .
you must be 16 or over and please ask the bill payer 's permission .
for full terms and conditions and more information visit our text to donate page .
author: Children in Need

documents.title: cin rickshaw challenge comes to cambridgeshire
text: today is day seven of the bbc children in need rickshaw challenge , and they 're on their way to cambridgeshire .
they 're setting off from king 's lynn and will make their way through places including littleport and ely before ending for the day in duxford .
today 's ride is 60 miles and is being led by the one show 's matt baker and six young riders , all of whom have been supported by bbc children in need funded projects .
the team are on a 470-mile journey from the scottish market town of jedburgh .
they are due to finish in central london tomorrow .
author: Children in Need

documents.title: children in need rickshaw rolls into town
text: the bbc children in need 's rickshaw challenge rolled into king 's lynn last night .
led by matt baker from the one show , the young riders had cycled 60 miles from skegness on day six of their 470-mile journey from scotland to london .
today they face another 60 miles journey south - travelling from king 's lynn , through littleport , cottenham and cambridge before reaching duxford..
if all goes to plan , they should arrive at the bbc studios in london tomorrow .
we wish them all the very best of luck .
ebony 's grand entrance at the close of day 6 .
we are in awe , ebony rounding off an almighty day for team rickshaw !

documents.title: 'best equipment ' helping police tackle hare coursing
text: for cambridgeshire police 's rural crime team to tackle the problem of hare coursing they need the best equipment , and luckily they have it .
pc sam thompson rides an off-road motorcycle to help chase hare coursers - saying it gives him the `` turn of speed '' he needs .
they also have the use of drones , helicopters , the dogs section and the firearms team if needed .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: hare coursing one of the biggest problems for rural crime team
text: for the past five days i 've been embedded with cambridgeshire police 's rural crime action team .
i 've seen them tackling a range of criminal activity in cambridgeshire 's countryside , but the most frequent problem they deal with is hare coursing .
so far this week i 've witnessed 51 reported hare coursing incidents , seen six vehicles seized , 14 people reported for offences and 22 s35 dispersals issued .
the latter means if they do n't get out of cambridgeshire , and stay away for 24 hours , they 'll be arrested .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police arrest men who were 'equipped to steal '
text: the long arm of the law was on two men in wisbech st mary last night , after police found them with an array of tools .
x2 males arrested last night in wisbech st mary for going equipped to steal .
we have some questions for them later at the # pic # 2445
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

there 'll be blustery showers , which could contain hail and thunder this afternoon , and also some sunny spells .
a cold wind means temperatures will struggle to reach a maximum of 10c ( 50f ) .

documents.title: goodbye from cambridgeshire live
text: that 's it from your cambridgeshire live team today .
thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back with updates on all your news , weather , sport and travel from 08:00 tomorrow .
but if anything breaks overnight , we 'll publish it here too .
in the meantime , you can still get in touch .
just drop us a line or send in a via email , facebook or twitter using # cmblive .
have a lovely evening .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crews to carry oxygen masks for pets
text: and finally special oxygen masks have been issued to fire crews in cambridgeshire , for use on pets .
the county 's fire and rescue service has teamed up with the national charity smokey paws to kit out six fire engines from dogsthorpe , huntingdon , cambridge , st neots , ely and kimbolton .
the masks supply 80 % more oxygen than conventional human masks .
firefighter neil hoskin said : `` as a dog owner i appreciate how important pets are to people .
`` some pet owners live alone and rely on the company of animals for support , so this is just as important to their welfare as well as the pet in a stressful rescue . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tonight 's weather : a cool night with scattered showers
text: tonight will be rather cloudy with scattered showers , some of which will be heavy , but which will clear southwards later .
later , a breeze will up , which should prevent a frost forming , with a low of 4c ( 39f ) .
a breeze will continue into tomorrow , with some showers or longer spells of rain and a high of 12c ( 39f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: pupil sex accused teacher had ex-wife 'under his spell '
text: the ex-wife of a boarding school teacher who had allegedly had sex with a pupil on top of her wedding dress has told a court he told her to lie to police that she disposed of it .

peterborough crown court heard simon ball , 42 , had hannah atherton , in her words , `` under his spell '' , and she gave police the account he wanted , as she did not want to appear the `` bitter ex-wife '' .
mrs atherton said the couple had split up over text messages he allegedly sent to pupils .
mr ball is accused of sexually abusing three female pupils at the private giggleswick school in settle , north yorkshire , where he taught in the early 2000s .
jurors were told he escaped prosecution before offending again at kimbolton school , near huntingdon .
however , the giggleswick investigation was re-opened after a former kimbolton pupil reported mr ball to police last year .

ball , of greenwich , admitted five counts of engaging in sexual activity while in a position of trust at kimbolton school at an earlier hearing , but denies a string of indecency and sexual assault charges relating to his time at giggleswick school .
the trial continues .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police linking five robberies in cambridge
text: detectives are linking a spate of armed robberies in cambridge .
on each occasion , two masked men , armed with knives , threatened staff and stole money .
these are the incidents they believe were carried out by the same people :
police are appealing for anyone with information to come forward .
a reward of up to £ 10,000 is being offered for information that leads to the arrest and charge of those involved .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: botanic garden lake to be dredged
text: the lake in the heart of cambridge 's botanic garden is to be dredged for the first time in almost 160 years .
a large build up of silt is affecting the lake 's oxygen levels , making it hard to sustain pond life .
the lake is a natural habitat for important species from all over the world , including the swamp cypress , as well as rushes , reeds and sedges .
the garden 's director , beverley glover , said the water was in desperate need of some tlc .

the lake is not just a beautiful part of the garden , but also an important ecological habitat which we want to conserve to sustain the diversity of plant and animal life that lives in and around it , '' she said .
the process of clearing and dredging the lake is expected to take three months and will start at the end of the month .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new euro mp for east
text: this is the new labour mep for the east of england .
alex mayer takes over from richard howitt , who stood down last month .
ms mayer has been a long standing member of the labour party and currently works for the cambridge mp daniel zeichner .
she was one of labour 's candidates in the 2014 euro elections .
under eu rules another election is n't held when an mep stands down , instead they are replaced by one of the failed candidates .
ms mayer said .
it 's a huge privilege to take on this role .
i pay tribute to my friend and colleague richard howitt who i am replacing , he has been an incredible servant to the region . ''
there are seven meps for the east of england .
three ukip , three conservatives and one labour .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: santa forgot : alzheimer 's research uk releases christmas appeal
text: cambridge-based alzheimer 's research uk has launched a new campaign set to pull the heartstrings this christmas .
the two-minute animation , called santa forgot , imagines a world where the magic of the season has gone because father christmas himself is living with the effects of dementia .
it will be broadcast on tv for the first time tonight .
it 's narrated by stephen fry .
the story shows a little girl called freya , who travels to the north pole to do something about santa 's absence .
redundant elves become researchers , demonstrating that with the right science a cure is achievable .
the charity says more than 850,000 people in the uk have dementia .
it says the condition also has an economic impact of more than £ 24bn a year - more than cancer and heart disease combined .
hilary evans , chief executive of alzheimer 's research uk , said the charity had to be provocative about the disease .
`` santa is an important cultural figure , but the idea that he too could be affected drives home the point that dementia can strike those most special in our lives .
`` we have made enormous strides against diseases like cancer and aids , and with the right research we can do the same for dementia .
santa forgot reminds us to believe in the power of research . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in the papers today
text: elsewhere in the county today :
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: calls to fast-track cambridge-oxford links
text: the national infrastructure commission is also calling for £ 27m of funding to be put towards the next stage of developing the oxford to cambridge expressway - the first high-quality road link between the university cities .
it could cut journey times by up to 40 % .

sir john armitt , deputy chairman of the nic , said boosting road and rail links could be a catalyst to delivering the housing and connectivity that the region needs to `` compete with the best in the world '' .
`` the corridor connecting cambridge , milton keynes and oxford could be britain 's silicon valley - a globally recognised centre for science , technology and innovation , '' he said .
`` but its future success is not guaranteed . ''
sir john added that transport links between cambridge and oxford were often slow , unreliable and congested and there was a failure to build the homes the corridor desperately needs .

`` these twin problems are already increasing costs for businesses and diminishing their ability to attract employees at all levels - including the recruitment and retention of globally mobile talent . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge-oxford link to create 'britain 's silicon valley '
text: britain could boast its own silicon valley if plans to re-establish the rail link between cambridge and oxford are fast-tracked .
the national infrastructure commission is urging the government to deliver the western section of the east west rail line by 2024 and bring forward £ 100m in funding .
it says speeding up the project will enable the creation of a corridor of innovation and learning , linking the two university cities by rail for the first time since 1967 .
the nic study into how to maximise the potential of the cambridge - milton keynes - oxford corridor found that a lack of sufficient and suitable housing presents a risk to the success of the area .
the report called for a `` joined-up plan '' for homes , jobs and infrastructure .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unitingcare contract : what the ccg says
text: responding to the criticisms , tracy dowling , chief officer at the cambridgeshire and peterborough ccg , told the bbc : `` we will fully consider the recommendations in today 's public accounts committee report to ensure that we have taken account of all possible learning from all the reviews .
`` when the contract ended the priority for all partners was ensuring the continuity of services for our patients .
making sure we deliver good quality services to those who need them remains as important to us today .
`` we are now working with our nhs and local authority partners to develop a sustainability and transformation plan , to address the challenges of a growing and ageing population .
`` this needs to be a robust plan which will allow us to meet our ambitions for health and care and to make services financially sustainable . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unitingcare contract : today 's report
text: the public accounts committee , made up of a cross-party group of mps , investigated the collapse of the £ 800m unitingcare contract .
it 's report is published today .
here are the main points :
our report on the unitingcare partnership contract has been published .
read it here # nhs
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unitingcare contract : the background
text: so how did this all come about ?
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unitingcare contract : a 'catalogue of failures '
text: the collapse of a contract that was supposed to provide mental health services and care for the elderly in cambridgeshire has been condemned in a parliamentary report .
the contract , worth £ 800m over five years , was won in april 2015 by a consortium known as the unitingcare partnership .
within eight months it had collapsed after it was deemed `` financially unsustainable '' by the nhs .
today the public accounts committee , made up of a cross-party group of mps , warned in its report that services for patients are likely to suffer as a result of a `` catalogue of failures '' .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: van and stock stolen in business burglary
text: burglars have stolen a van , equestrian equipment and tack from a farm shop in witchford .
it happened between 17:30 on monday and 05:30 on tuesday morning at scott 's farm shop in sutton road , close to the a142 .
items stolen included a white transit van with registration wm52 lbu , a large quantity of fruit and vegetables and various equestrian equipment .
the offenders left behind a small green wooden trailer .
det con simon rampley said : `` this burglary has had a significant impact on the business and local community .
`` i 'd urge anyone who saw anything sus in the area last night or who has been offered the items listed to contact us as soon as possible . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: when mannequins misbehave
text: it 's the craze that 's currently taking social media by storm .
if it 's good enough for hillary clinton , then it 's good enough for fenland police .
this is their version of the # mannequinchallenge .
when mannequins misbehave # mannequinchallenge # safercambs

documents.title: weather : breezy with outbreaks of patchy rain
text: a ty autumnal today with very little change expected over the next 24 hours .
the day will start grey with glimmers of bright spells amongst the patchy rain .
mild for the time of year at 12c ( 54f ) and it will be rather breezy throughout the day too .
tonight will remain cloudy and the rain should diminish overnight .
weather has your local forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning and welcome to local live for cambridgeshire .
between now and 18:00 we 'll be bringing you all your news , sport , travel and in a moment a full weather report .

documents.title: goodbye from cambridgeshire
text: that 's it from your cambridgeshire live team today .
we 'll do it all again in the morning with updates on all your news , weather , sport and travel from 08:00 .
in the meantime you can still get in touch .
just drop us a line or send in a via email , facebook or twitter using # cmblive .
we love to hear from you .
have a good evening and wrap up warm .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: regional weather : rather cloudy with outbreaks of rain in places
text: this evening and tonight will be cloudy with further outbreaks of rain across southern counties , becoming mostly dry with clear spells elsewhere .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
any early rain will clear in the morning , and it 'll become bright with sunny spells , although there 's a chance of some showers developing later .
feeling cooler as the breeze up , with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: cambridge 's new development takes shape from the air
text: take at look at this incredible drone footage of cambridge 's newest district .
the first phase of the north west cambridge development will be complete next year , with the local centre to be known as eddington .
three years after the diggers moved in , the massive building works is the university of cambridge 's largest single construction project .
the new district already has a primary school on site and will include more than a thousand homes , a supermarket , community centre and private housing .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teen creates electric skateboard
text: a teenager has built an electric skateboard using a computer that cost just a few pounds .
matthew timmons-brown , 17 , from cambridge , designed it using a raspberry pi zero .
his board , which can reach speeds of up to 18mph , is operated with a games console controller .
the sixth-form student 's next ambition is to create a mars rover , he says .

documents.title: four forces trial new gps tagging
text: four of the region 's police forces are piloting a new tagging system designed to monitor the movements of offenders on early release from prison .
cambridgeshire , bedfordshire , hertfordshire and northamptonshire will trial the new tags , which will use gps technology .
hertfordshire already uses tagging , but it 's been on a voluntary basis until now .
the tags will allow police to track the locations of prisoners , enforce curfews and prevent contact with victims and other criminals .
regional project lead , det insp craig flint from hertfordshire constabulary , said : `` all those selected to take part in the pilot have been carefully considered and fully risk assessed .
`` throughout this pilot the public 's safety and protecting people from crime remains a priority .
`` this tagging technology is being used in support of , and not as a replacement for , other more traditional policing methods . ''
four prisoners are currently wearing the new tags - all aged between 26 and 44 years .
the pilot will run for 12 months .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fatal collision on a1307 : victim named
text: a man who died on the a1307 during yesterday 's rush-hour has been named .
curtis payne , 23 , of limes avenue , chigwell , was driving a ford transit van between cambridge and linton at about 08:00 .
the crash also involved a black hyundai tucson and a volvo lorry .
mr payne died at the scene .
no-one else was injured .
police have renewed an appeal for witnesses .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: t'is the season for rehoming
text: after the news yesterday some fluffy felines were looking for a new home for christmas , another cambridgeshire charity says it 's hoping for some festive goodwill .
the british hen welfare trust in godmanchester wants to re-home hundreds of birds that would otherwise be slaughtered once their egg-laying days are over .
cue hen in a christmas hat klaxon
co-ordinator mel lazenby , said : `` it really is the best feeling knowing you have helped these hens start a new life fresh out of their cages .
`` there are hundreds with their suitcases packed , tinsel in beak , hoping to go off to new homes . ''
anyone interested in taking some in is urged to contact the trust 's headquarters to register .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rory mcgrath charged with stalking
text: rory mcgrath charged with stalking

documents.title: in the papers today
text: a date has been set for that christmas tree to return to cathedral square in peterborough , according to the evening telegraph .
the paper says it 'll be ready in all its glory from friday , 18 november , with the city 's lights being switched on the following night .
if you need a reminder of the tree that was likened by a councillor to a huge plate of ferrero rocher chocolates , this shot was taken by bbc radio cambridgeshire 's dotty mcleod last year .
meanwhile , the cambridge news reports on the continued search for the missing raf serviceman corrie mckeague , as a lane of the a14 in suffolk is closed off .
the search along the eastbound carriageway will continue for much of the day .
and the wisbech standard reveals the nene supermarket on lynn road has been refused an alcohol license after objections from the police , council and locals .
the store lies in the heart of the town 's anti-alcohol zone .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tills removed in armed robbery
text: two men are being hunted by police after an armed robbery in brampton last night .
it happened at the co-op on the high street just before 22:00 .
a member of staff was threatened and suffered slight injuries to his face .
police say the men , armed with knives , demanded money before removing two tills and a bottle of vodka .
one of the men is described as white , about six feet tall and in his 20s .
he was wearing a faded blue hooded top and black gloves , and spoke with a local accent .
the second man was older and slim and wearing all white .
anyone with information is asked to call police or crimestoppers anonymously .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge 's newest district : from the air
text: three years after the diggers moved in , cambridge 's brand new suburb is taking shape .
the first phase of the north west cambridge development will be complete next year , with the local centre to be known as eddington .
the project is the university of cambridge 's largest single construction project .
three million hours on site have been clocked up to date .
the new district already has a primary school on site and will include more than a thousand homes for university staff and post-grad students .
a supermarket , community centre and private housing are also on the horizon .
construction director gavin heaphy said : `` the pace of construction has been incredible .
`` reaching another milestone this year highlights the intensity of construction and the scale of the project . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: marks and spencer 'very disappointed ' over peterborough store closure 'speculation '
text: we 've just heard back from m & s after a report from the local data company said a store in peterborough was at risk of closure .
a spokesperson for the company said it was `` very disappointed that anyone would choose to speculate in this way '' .
m & s said the list of 52 stores compiled by the retail analysts `` is not based on any m & s data and we have not published any locations '' .

the retailer added : `` what we have done is outlined plans to improve our store estate over the next five years , which include opening 200 new food stores and selling clothing and home from 60 fewer stores . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peterborough m & s stores may close , says retail analyst report
text: a new report suggests a marks and spencer store in peterborough is at risk of closure , as the retailer looks to implement turnaround plans announced last week .
m & s announced it will close 30 uk clothing and homeware shops and convert dozens more into food stores .
retail analysts , the local data company , have looked at various factors and revealed 52 stores which could be at risk of closure , conversion or moved to a smaller site .
the report says `` the most obvious '' thing would be to close stores in towns which have more than one , and peterborough has two .
marks and spencer chief executive steve rowe would not be drawn on the store closures when he announced the plans last week .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university graduates from anglia ruskin make top book list
text: two illustrators and writers from anglia ruskin university have made the new york times top 10 .
little red ( below ) by bethan woollvin and the polar bear by jenni desmond have made it onto the newspaper 's 10 best illustrated children 's books of 2016 list .
bethan ( below ) , 22 , who grew up in south woodham ferrers in essex , graduated from anglia ruskin university , cambridge , last year with a first class ba ( hons ) illustration degree .

in 2014 her initial illustrations for little red helped her win the national macmillan prize for illustration , and the rights for the book were subsequently snapped up by publishing giants pan macmillan .
meanwhile , jenni desmond , from hackney , graduated from the ma in children 's book illustration in 2011 .
bethan woollvin said : `` it 's such wonderful news and it means so much for my career in illustration .
`` little red has come so far since it started as just a small idea while i was studying at the cambridge school of art , and i really owe that all to my fabulous lecturers . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: in supermoon over cambridgeshire
text: last night the moon came closer to earth than at any other time since 1948 .
despite some cloudy skies , some bbc weather watchers were able to snap these
author: BBC Weather Watchers

text: a cloudy and grey day , with outbreaks of rain later .
feeling mild , with light winds .
temperatures reaching a maximum of 14c ( 57f ) .
kate kinsella has the details for you .
you can find more details here .

text: good morning .
did you get to see the `` supermoon '' last night ?
we 'll have some of your the phenomenon later .
you can send us your by heading to twitter .
plus we 'll have all the news , sport , and travel for cambridgeshire .
and shortly we 'll have the day 's weather forecast for you .

we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news from around cambridgeshire .
but stay tuned to this page overnight for any breaking news .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : mild overnight and tomorrow
text: it 'll be a cloudy night with the last of any rain eventually clearing and it 'll be mild too - many places staying in double figures .
tomorrow will remain largely cloudy with outbreaks of showery rain pushing southwards .
we may get some brighter conditions into the north of the region later in the day .
staying very mild , with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: how to get the best photo of the 'supermoon ' - according to nasa
text: if there happens to be a break in the cloud where you live tonight , you might want to photograph the `` supermoon '' which wo n't be this close to earth again until november 2034 .
nasa has issued some top tips on taking a memorable image , which include :
we 're also told that if you 're prepared to wait until tuesday , weather conditions should be better , although the moon wo n't be at its biggest size .

documents.title: six cars seized at illegal travellers ' site
text: police responding to reports of a sus vehicle at an illegal travellers ' site in peterborough ended up with not one , but six dodgy motors .
a number of caravans and other vehicles moved onto land at stanground community centre on whittlesey road , prompting roads police to pay a visit .
they were looking for one vehicle with suspected false plates .
they found it , and five others .
all were seized and removed by officers on sunday , who are continuing to investigate the finds .
peterborough city council confirmed the caravans left the site on sunday evening .

documents.title: 'bird-watching ' with the hare coursers
text: i 've spent the weekend with members of the police 's rural team as they tackle crime in the countryside .
we began by responding to reports of hare coursing , and as the suspects made off , i realised there 's more to a car pursuit than putting your foot down .
officers warned each other there was a children 's football match nearby , and they had to be mindful of that if they ended up in a chase .
it turned into a bit of a cat and mouse game - every time we chased , the suspects across a field got to a road .
when we got there , they 're back across a field .
unfortunately , flying conditions on this day meant they could n't call on the helicopter for back-up .
but when we did catch up with some suspected hare-coursers , they claimed they were `` bird-watching , mate '' .
they 're promptly told to leave the county and not return across the border .
`` if i 'm not allowed to bird-watch here , i 'll go bird-watching elsewhere in kent , '' one suspect tells the officer .
`` there are some nice birds down there , '' the officer replied .
the rural crime team is letting me stay with them for a few more days , so keep watching here for further updates on `` bird-watching '' and other country pursuits .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: council defends parking hike proposals
text: the council has been defending its plans to put up parking charges at its multi-storey car parks in cambridge .
it could cost you £ 26 to stay for more than five hours on a sunday in the grand arcade , if proposals are passed .

some shoppers told us it 'd put them off and they 'd go elsewhere , but kevin blencowe , from the city council 's planning policy and transport team , described cheaper parking on a sunday as a `` historical anomaly '' .

`` the number of people using the car parks has risen in the past two years , '' he said , adding that people had `` made their choices in the knowledge that cambridge is an expensive place to park '' .
the plans were there to encourage more people to use public transport such as park and ride , he told me .
`` saturday charges are high for people who [ park ] long stay , but we want to discourage long stay , believe it or not we want to get people to park and ride .
`` personally i see [ sundays ] as the same as saturdays these days .
the numbers of people coming into the city are almost the same . ''
if the plans go ahead the new charges will be introduced on 1 april next year .
author: Dotty McLeod
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: obligatory cute kitten moment
text: it 's a dreary day , so here 's something to make you go `` awwww ''
these little bundles of fluff were all born into feral colonies which is `` an extremely tough start for any kitten '' , volunteers at fenland animal rescue say .
but these eight kittens from two litters have been fostered and socialised and have become incredibly friendly , they add .
`` playtime never stops for these balls of joy , '' they tell me , but i 'm not sure my own cat wants a new playmate , so the push is on to find them new homes before christmas .
they 're all fully checked , chipped and trained and ready to go to forever homes .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: doctor jailed over child and animal porn
text: doctor jailed over child and animal porn

documents.title: will parking charges change shopping habits ?
text: shoppers have been reacting to proposed increases in sunday parking charges by saying they might boycott cambridge in favour of other areas .
earlier we told you about the city council 's proposals to bring sunday charges in line with those on a saturday .
bury st edmunds seemed to be a popular destination when we asked people if they 'd go elsewhere .
`` if it was as expensive on sunday as saturday , yes , i 'd go elsewhere , '' one man told us .
`` there 's bury st edmunds , or there 's norwich , which is now very easy to get to , '' another said .
one woman who took her family shopping to peterborough last weekend described the day - and the £ 2 charge at the privately-run queensgate car park - as `` absolutely brilliant '' .
another opted for ely , because with free parking she said it was `` a real pleasure '' to shop , without worrying about forking out additional cash at the end of the day .
we 'll hear what the council has to say about its proposals later .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: tackling crime with the countryside cops
text: two car chases , 13 hare coursers caught , a few vehicles seized and a potential flare-up at a hunt skilfully avoided all in a day 's work for the county 's massively busy rural crime unit .
i 've been given a rare insight into the work of cambridgeshire police 's rural crime action team ( rcat ) , by far the biggest and busiest countryside unit across the east of england .

its team of 10 includes a member of the crown prosecution service and their access to hardware is unparalleled , including high-performance vehicles , off-road motorcycles , drones and a police helicopter .
i 'll bring you more on their tireless efforts to clear the countryside of crime , later .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: johnston press confirms title sale talks
text: johnston press confirms title sale talks

documents.title: daisy the satellite swan touches down
text: the first of this season 's gps-tagged bewick 's swans has arrived back at welney for the winter .
daisy clarke touched down at the wildfowl and wetland trust 's reserve on the cambridgeshire-norfolk border last week .
she 'd made the journey across the north sea from the netherlands to take up her winter roost on the ouse washes , alongside almost 1,000 others which are permanent residents at the site .
daisy was first tagged in january 2015 .

documents.title: posh have nothing to fear - mccann
text: posh have nothing to fear - mccann

documents.title: person dies in three-vehicle crash
text: meanwhile , we 've just heard a person has died after three vehicles crashed during this morning 's rush hour .
cambridgeshire police tells us a lorry , van and car collided on the a1307 in little abington at about 07:50 .
details are `` sketchy '' at the moment , a spokesman said , but we 'll bring you more as we get it .
the road is closed in both directions between hildersham road in little abington and high street , hildersham .
further to our last tweet # rtc # a1307 # linton .
there are road closures in place on # a1307 # littleabington and # a1307 # hildersham
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: victim of a11 collision named by police
text: a young woman who died following a collision on the a11 in the early hours of friday , was named over the weekend as lauren danks , 22 , from soham in cambridgeshire .
police were called just after midnight , to reports a vehicle had been found off the southbound carriageway at red lodge .
she was found inside the car , but had died at the scene .

a 63-year-old man from the brandon area , who was arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving , drink driving , and failing to stop following a collision , has been released on police bail until 6 may 2017 .

documents.title: sewer woes lead to roadworks on major city road
text: drivers in cambridge are being warned of disruption on east road while anglian water carries out emergency sewer repairs .
one lane will be closed and two-way traffic lights put in place from today .
apparently a collapsed pipe four metres underground is at risk of leaking , so there 'll be traffic lights in place 24 hours a day during the two weeks the work will last .
businesses are open as usual and anglian water has apologised for any inconvenience .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: sunday parking charges could more than double at some city car parks
text: proposals to raise sunday parking charges in cambridge 's multi-storey car parks could see prices more than double for long stays .
it means shopping for more than five hours on a sunday in the grand arcade would cost you £ 26 .
it 's part of the city council 's plans to bring sundays in line with saturdays but it 's also considering reducing the price to park on mondays and tuesdays .
the same sunday five-hour stay at queensgate in peterborough would cost you just £ 2 .
will it put you off spending the day in cambridge ?
we 'll bring you views from shoppers , councillors and businesses shortly .

documents.title: monday 's weather : cloudy and breezy with patchy rain
text: today will be mild but breezy , with outbreaks of mostly light or patchy rain .
there 'll be some glimmers of brightness too , with highs of around 11c ( 52f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
author: Aisling Creevey
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to monday 's updates for cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and welcome to another week .
we 're here once more with live news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county between now and 18:00 .
today we 'll be looking at proposed increases in parking charges for sunday shoppers in cambridge and we 're out and about with our rural police officers .
more on those stories shortly .
feel free to contact us with your .
or comments today .
get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News
